intro: Baccharoides calvoana subsp. ulugurensis, commonly known as the Uluguru bushwillow, is a shrub or small tree native to the Uluguru Mountains of Tanzania. It belongs to the family Tamaricaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native region. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing shelter and food for local wildlife.
